findings.title: OTUT - Transfers User's Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to transfer the balance of a user's address to any address or addresses without allowance.

findings.title: ELFM - Exceeds Fees Limit
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to increase over the allowed limit of 25%. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `setFees` and/or `set_sell_multiplier` functions with a high percentage value.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity, leading to issues with precise calculations with decimal numbers.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but the variable `swapThreshold` can be set to a big number, triggering a huge amount of token swaps and potentially leading to significant price volatility.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: By declaring a variable as immutable, the Solidity compiler is able to make certain optimizations. This can reduce the amount of storage and computation required by the contract, and make it more gas-efficient.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to decrease gas consumption and ensure the value cannot be changed after it has been set.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity naming convention guidelines, which can decrease readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract does not validate variable setters which can lead to unexpected behavior or errors. Adding proper checks can prevent the contract from being exploited or operating unexpectedly.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: According to the ERC20 specification, the transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful. Otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.
